LMTF&M
ID:415-433-7408
JUN 10'96 17:22 No.012 P.18
California Courts and Judges
Profiles 411
Ogden, Utah. Married Sandra Van de Wall Jan 23. 1965 in Park City, Utah. Four children: Susan, born April 8, 1969: James, born May 30. 1970; Kathryn. born May 9, 1976: and Andrew, born Oct 5. 1980.
Faculty, Calif Continuing Judicial Studies Program ("CJSP.") [CJER). 1991 ("Domestic Violence in the Civil and Criminal Courts"]. 1986 (Advanced Civil Procedure*), and 1984 ("Criminal Law Update").
Member: Calif Judges Assh. 1981 -: Benevolent and Protective Order of Elks. 1979 -: Knights of Columbus. 1970- [4th Degree), Rotary Club, 1979 ... (inactive). and United Way. 1979- (former County Employees Chairgran). all In Santa Maria. Santa Barbara County Former member: Board of Advisors. Shelter Services for Women, 1992; and Advisory Board, Salvation Army. 1991. Rast President. Northern Santa Barbara County Bar Assn, 1978-79. Roman Catholic.
Office: Courthouse. Dept SM-4. 312-C East Cook Street, PO Box 5369, Santa Maria 93-156. (895) 346-7480.
JENSEN, D. [Delwen] Lowell. JUDGE. UNIT- ED STATES DISTRICT COURT. Northern District of Callfornia. Nominated [succeeding Judge William H. Orrick, Jr., retired to Senior Judge status] by President Reagan June 2. 1986, confirmed by U.S. Senate June 24, 1986. commission issued June 25. 1986. and oath June 27, 1986. Deputy Attorney General. U.S. Dept of Justice. Washington. D.C., May 22. 1985 to June 27. 1986 (2nd-ranking Justice Dept official under U.S. Attorney General Edwin Meese IIl; all components of Dept, Including FBI. DEA. U.S. Marshals Service. Bureau of Prisons. INS, Litigating Divisions, and U.S. Attorneys report to Attorney General through Deputy Attorney Generall. Associate Attorney General. U.S. Dept of Justice. Washington. D.C., July 28. 1983 to May 22. 1985. Assistant Attorney General. U.S. Dept of Justice, Washington. D.C .. April 7. 1981 to July 29. 1983 (in charge of criminal division, duties of which included overseeing FBI and Drug Enforcement Administration as well as federal fight against organized and white collar crime). District Attorney. Alameda County, July 1969 to April 1981, appointed to position In 1969, elected in 1970. and reelected in 1974 and 1978 (most publicized local cases he tried as District Attorney include prosecution of Russell Little and Joseph Remiro, charged with assassination of Oakland schools Superintendent Marcus Foster (first offense committed by so-called Symbionese Liberation Army); William and Emily Harris In Patricia Hearst kidnapping: and Black Panther Party founder Huey Newton for murder of Oakland police officeri. Assistant District Attorney (July 1966 to July 1969) and Deputy District Attorney (July 1955 to July 1966). Alameda County (during 1960's. was locally well-known, Logether with then Alameda County Deputy District Attorney Edwin Meese III. for tough prosecution of students in Free Speech and anti-war demonstrations at Univ of Calif. Berkeley: most publicized case was People v. Mario Savio, et al., in which then deputy district attorney Jensen headed prosecution of Free Speech Movement sit-in at University of California's Sproul Hall in Dee
1964, resulting in arrest and prosecution of 778 defendants; principal trial was 4-month nonjury trial of 155 defendants in single trial). Certified Specialist in Criminal Law. 1973. Admitted to Calif Bar Feb 21. 1953: to U.S. DIst Court. Northern Dist of Calif, in 1968; and to U.S. Supreme Court in 1982. J.D. [1952]. Univ of Callf. Berkeley. Bualt Hall School of Law. B.A. (1949), Univ of Calif. Berkeley. Graduate (1945). Alameda High School, Alameda, Alameda County. Served to corporal. U.S. Army. Korean War, Oct 1952 to Sept 1954 (Signal Corps). Born June 3. 1928 In Brigham City, Utah. Married Barbara Jane Cowin April 20, 1951 In Calif, Three children: Peter L .. born In 1955: Marcia Jensen Allmand. born in 1956: and Thomas C., born in 1960.
Participant. 14th Federal Practice Institute, 1991 ("Temporary and Preliminary Relief, Motions, and Summary Judgment"). Served as Lecturer, Panelist, or Instructor on Criminal Law for: Northwestern School of Law, Short Course for Prosecutors, 1979-82; National College of District Attorneys, 1981. 1978. 1977: CJER Institutes, 1978 and 1973: Hastings College of Advocacy. 1978: CEB. 1975: and American Bar Assn, Effective Criminal Trial Techniques. 1975. Author: "The Good Faith Restatement of the Exclusionary Rule." Journal of Criminal Law and Criminology (1982; Northwestern Univ School of Law): and "Diminished Capacity. Tying the Hands of Justice." Brief Case (1979; Bar Assn of San Francisco).
Fellow. American College of Trial Lawyers, 1975 -. Member: Advisory Committee on Criminal Rules. Judicial Conference of the U.S .. Oct 1991 -: and Boalt Hall Alumni Asan, 1952- (President, 1978). Former member: Advisory Policy Board. National Crime Information Center (NCIC) 1979-81 and 1987-91: American Bar Assn. 1981-86 (Vice Chairman. Prosecution Function Committee. Criminal Justice Section. 1951-86: member, Advisory Board. Mental Health Standards Task Force. 1981-83]: Federal Bar Assn. 1981-83: National District Attorneys Assn. 1974-SG [Assistant Treasurer, 1980: Commission on Victim/Witness Assistance, 1974-81}: Calif District Attorneys Assn, 1966-81 (President, 1979-80: Chairman. Law and Legislative Committee, 1969-77); Calif Council on Criminal Justice (State Planning Agency). 1974-81; Advisory Committee on Criminal Rules to Judicial Conference of United States. 1981-83: Calif Judicial Council's Sentencing Practices Advisory Committee (Rules for Determinate Sentencing). 1977-81, and Comparative Study of ABA Standards on Criminal Justice, 1972: Advisory Board. Calif Crime Technological Research Foundation. 1970-74: Calif State Bar's Commission on Law and Mental Health Problems. 1976-78; Task Force on Incarcerated Minorities (Advisory to Callf Health & Welfare Dept. 1980-81: Calif Peace Officers Assn, 1969-81 (Chairman. Law and Legislative Committee. 1969-77); Advisory Board, Hastings Law School College of Advocacy. 1977-86: Alameda County Bar Assn. 1974-81 (former member: Bench-Bar Liaison Committee: and Benchi-Bar-Medin Committee); and Criminal Courtx Bar Assn of Alameda County. 1965-81 (Co-founder, 1965; former member. Advisory
